name: Dissociative Amnesia with Fugue State
chief_complaint: I woke up in a different city with no memory of how I got there or who I am
prognosis: Variable; most recover memories within days to weeks, but some develop chronic dissociative symptoms requiring long-term therapy
description: A rare dissociative disorder characterized by sudden, unexpected travel away from home with inability to recall one's past and confusion about personal identity. Often precipitated by severe psychological stress or trauma. Differs from standard dissociative amnesia by the purposeful travel component.
